p: In summer 2009, the flowers of A. orientalis were collected from Markazi province, Iran. Itconsisted of 15 monoterpene hydrocarbons (61.3%), 19 oxygentatedmonoterpenes (18.3%), 15 sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (4.6%), 9oxygentatedsesquiterpenes (6.3%) and 5nonterpenoids compounds (2.4%). Sabinene (16.5%) and α-pinene (11.0%) were the major components in the flower oil of Astrodaucus orientalis, followed by myrcene (7.0%), p-cymene (6.1%), α-thujene (6.1%) and β-pinene (5.2%) ( Masoudi et al., 2012). Table 3presents the comparative list of major compounds of different parts of A. orientalis identified ina study in 2009 ( Nazemiyeh et al., 2009).
